page.title: 10Samares Manor
page.content: {Samares Manor}is an old Manor house in the parish of St.Clement; nowadays it is a tourist attraction. Samares Manor is the home of the Obbard family; it is surrounded by a small park and farm land. The house is private but the grounds are open to the public. {Samares Manor has the ancient right to {the reef south of Jersey called the {Minquiers.}There is a small island called{Maitresse Isle}which has on it a number of fishermen's huts. At low tide many rocks are exposed and it is a good place for low water fishing. In the past if anything was washed ashore on the Minquiers it would go to Samares Manor, that was the law and that is why the Minquiers are a part of Jersey. The French have challenged this ancient right but the{ {International Court at the Hague}ruled in Britain's favour in this dispute.
